Overview Package Class Index No Frames Frames Prev Next

Summary: TYPE FUNCTION
fgl

fglcdvCalendar

Genero 4GL wrapper around the Calendar plugin at https://github.com/FourjsGenero-Cordova-Plugins/Calendar-PhoneGap-Plugin

TYPE Summary
CALENDAR_DATE DATETIME YEAR TO SECOND
RecurrenceRuleT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R10>
TIME_AS_NUMBER DECIMAL
attendeesT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R8>
calendarT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R4>
eventOptionsT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R2>
eventT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R12>
findOptionsT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R6>

FUNCTION Summary
createCalendar(calendarName STRING, color STRING) RETURNS STRING
Creates a new Calendar.

Creates a new event interactively with a native UI dialog.

Deletes a set of events for a specific calendar (iOS only) Note that this function is not supported on Android. The given parameters are used to identify one or more events, so for example events in a given time frame can be deleted.

Deletes a set of events for the active calendar. The given parameters are used to identify one or more events, so for example events in a given time frame can be deleted.

Finds events either via id or by the combination of title...endTime. The calendarName option is only valid under IOS and only effective if id is not set.

Helper function for findEventsWithOptions

Types

CALENDAR_DATE

TYPE CALENDAR_DATE DATETIME YEAR TO SECOND

RecurrenceRuleT

TYPE RecurrenceRuleT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R10>
    
freq STRING
interval INTEGER
wkst STRING
byday STRING
bymonthday STRING
until CALENDAR_DATE
count INTEGER
END RECORD

TIME_AS_NUMBER

TYPE TIME_AS_NUMBER DECIMAL

attendeesT

TYPE attendeesT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R8>
    
name STRING
URL STRING
status STRING
type STRING
role STRING
END RECORD

calendarT

TYPE calendarT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R4>
    
id STRING
name STRING
type STRING
END RECORD

eventOptionsT

TYPE eventOptionsT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R2>
    
title STRING
location STRING
notes STRING
startDate CALENDAR_DATE
endDate CALENDAR_DATE
options RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R1>
    
allday BOOLEAN
firstReminderMinutes INTEGER
secondReminderMinutes INTEGER
recurrence STRING
recurrenceInterval INTEGER
recurrenceEndDate CALENDAR_DATE
calendarName STRING
calendarId STRING
url STRING
spanFutureEvents BOOLEAN
END RECORD
END RECORD

eventT

TYPE eventT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R12>
    
title STRING
calendar STRING
id STRING
startDate CALENDAR_DATE
endDate CALENDAR_DATE
lastModified CALENDAR_DATE
firstReminderMinutes FLOAT
secondReminderMinutes FLOAT
location STRING
url STRING
notes STRING
allday BOOLEAN
attendees DYNAMIC ARRAY OF attendeesT
rrule RecurrenceRuleT
END RECORD

findOptionsT

TYPE findOptionsT RECORD <anonymous fglcdvCalendar R6>
    
title STRING
location STRING
notes STRING
startDate CALENDAR_DATE
endDate CALENDAR_DATE
id STRING
calendarName STRING
END RECORD

Functions

createCalendar

FUNCTION createCalendar(calendarName STRING, color STRING) RETURNS STRING

Creates a new Calendar.

Parameters:
calendarName - name for the newly created calendar.
color - an RGB value in the style of '#ff0000' is required, or NULL.
Returns:
NULL on error, an id for the created calendar

createEventInteractively

FUNCTION createEventInteractively(options eventOptionsT) RETURNS STRING

Creates a new event interactively with a native UI dialog.

Parameters:
options - see eventOptionsT
Returns:
an event id on success, NULL in case of error. Use getLastError() to retrieve the error message. On IOS, the event id can be used to modify or delete the event. On Android, the event id cannot be used for further operations.

createEventWithOptions

FUNCTION createEventWithOptions(options eventOptionsT) RETURNS STRING

Creates a new calendar event with an option record.

Parameters:
options - see eventOptionsT
Returns:
an event id on success, NULL in case of error. Use getLastError() to retrieve the error message On IOS, the event id can be used to modify or delete the event. On Android, the event id cannot be used for further operations.

dateTime2MilliSinceEpoch

FUNCTION dateTime2MilliSinceEpoch(d CALENDAR_DATE)

Converts a CALENDAR_DATE into the milliseconds since epoch (1970-01-01)

In JavaScript, getTime() of a new created Date returns a number of milliseconds since 1970-01-01 as well.

Parameters:
d - the CALENDAR_DATE to convert
Returns:
the milliseconds since 1970-01-01

deleteCalendar

FUNCTION deleteCalendar(calendarName STRING) RETURNS STRING

Deletes the given calendar

Parameters:
calendarName - must not be NULL
Returns:
NULL on error , an ok string indicating the deletion was performed otherwise

deleteEvent

FUNCTION deleteEvent(event eventT, spanFutureEvents BOOLEAN) RETURNS STRING

Deletes an event for the active calendar.

Parameters:
event - structure returned by findEvent
spanFutureEvents - If set and the event is recurring, all recurring events will be removed too, otherwise only the event with matching startDate etc will be deleted.
Returns:
NULL in case of error, a non NULL string if the deletion was successful. Use getLastError() to get the error reason.

deleteEventFromNamedCalendar

FUNCTION deleteEventFromNamedCalendar(event eventT, spanFutureEvents BOOLEAN, calendarName STRING) RETURNS STRING

Deletes an event for a specific calendar (iOS only). Note that this function is not supported on Android.

Parameters:
event - structure returned by findEvent.
spanFutureEvents - If set and the event is recurring, all recurring events will be removed too, otherwise only the event with matching startDate etc will be deleted.
calendarName - calendar where the deletion should take place.
Returns:
NULL in case of error, a non NULL string if the deletion was successful. Use getLastError() to get the error reason.

deleteEventFromNamedCalendarWithFindOptions

FUNCTION deleteEventFromNamedCalendarWithFindOptions(findOptions findOptionsT, spanFutureEvents BOOLEAN, calendarName STRING) RETURNS STRING

Deletes a set of events for a specific calendar (iOS only) Note that this function is not supported on Android. The given parameters are used to identify one or more events, so for example events in a given time frame can be deleted.

Parameters:
findOptions - same as for finding an event.
spanFutureEvents - If set and the event is recurring, all recurring events will be removed too, otherwise only the event with matching startDate etc will be deleted.
calendarName - calendar where the deletion should take place
Returns:
NULL in case of error, a non NULL string if the deletion was successful. Use getLastError() to get the error reason.

deleteEventWithFindOptions

FUNCTION deleteEventWithFindOptions(findOptions findOptionsT, spanFutureEvents BOOLEAN) RETURNS STRING

Deletes a set of events for the active calendar. The given parameters are used to identify one or more events, so for example events in a given time frame can be deleted.

Parameters:
findOptions - same as for finding an event
spanFutureEvents - If set and the event is recurring, all recurring events will be removed too, otherwise only the event with matching startDate etc will be deleted.
Returns:
NULL in the error case, an non NULL string if the deletion was successful. Use getLastError() to get the error reason

findEventsWithOptions

FUNCTION findEventsWithOptions(options findOptionsT) RETURNS DYNAMIC ARRAY OF eventT, STRING

Finds events either via id or by the combination of title...endTime. The calendarName option is only valid under IOS and only effective if id is not set.

   DEFINE options fglcdvCalendar.findOptionsT
   DEFINE eventArr DYNAMIC ARRAY OF fglcdvCalendar.eventT
   LET options=fglcdvCalendar.getFindOptions()
   LET options.startTime=CURRENT
   LET options.endTime=CURRENT+7
   --return the events for 1 week in the default calendar
   CALL fglcdvCalendar.findEventWithOptions(options) RETURNING eventArr

Parameters:
options - see findOptionsT
Returns:
an array of events (can be empty) + an NOT NULL error string in the error case

getFindOptions

FUNCTION getFindOptions() RETURNS findOptionsT

Helper function for findEventsWithOptions

Returns:
an initialized findOptionsT RECORD

getLastError

FUNCTION getLastError() RETURNS STRING

gives back the last Error message of the previous operation

Returns:
the error message

hasReadPermission

FUNCTION hasReadPermission() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Checks if we are allowed to read from the Calendar On IOS this includes also the write permission

Returns:
TRUE upon success, FALSE otherwise

hasReadWritePermission

FUNCTION hasReadWritePermission() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Checks if we are allowed to read/write information from/to the Calendar

Returns:
TRUE upon success, FALSE otherwise

hasWritePermission

FUNCTION hasWritePermission() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Checks if we are allowed to write information to the Calendar On IOS this include also the read permission

Returns:
TRUE upon success, FALSE otherwise

init

FUNCTION init()

Initializes the fglcdvCalendar Cordova plugin library. Must be called prior to other calls for the plugin library.

isRecurring

FUNCTION isRecurring(event eventT) RETURNS BOOLEAN

Returns whether the given event is a recurring event.

Parameters:
event - is an eventT returned by findEvents.
Returns:
TRUE when event is recurring, FALSE if NOT recurring.

listCalendars

FUNCTION listCalendars() RETURNS DYNAMIC ARRAY OF calendarT, STRING

Returns a list of all calendars.

Returns:
a list of calendars + a non NULL error string in case of error.

modifyEventInteractively

FUNCTION modifyEventInteractively(event eventT) RETURNS STRING

Modifies the given event in a native UI dialog.

Parameters:
event - the event to modify
Returns:
"Canceled", "Saved" or "Deleted" to indicate the action performed in the modification dialog.

modifyEventInteractivelyWithFindOptions

FUNCTION modifyEventInteractivelyWithFindOptions(findOptions findOptionsT) RETURNS STRING

This function modifies an existing event by using a native UI dialog, with find options to identify the event.

Parameters:
findOptions - if the find options contain a valid event id (returned by createEventWithOptions) the changes act on that event. Using NULL for the id uses the title, location, etc. to find the event
Returns:
"Canceled", "Saved" or "Deleted" to indicate the action performed in the modification dialog. In case of error, the error can be retrieved with getLastError()

modifyEventWithOptions

FUNCTION modifyEventWithOptions(findOptions findOptionsT, changeOptions eventOptionsT) RETURNS STRING

This function modifies an existing event (iOS only). Note that this function is not supported on Android.

Parameters:
findOptions - if the find options contain a valid event id (returned by createEventWithOptions) the changes act on that event. Using NULL for the id uses the title, location, etc. to find the event
changeOptions - contains the values to override the old values in the event.
Returns:
the event Identifier if a change took place, NULL otherwise. In case of error, the error can be retrieved with getLastError()

openCalendar

FUNCTION openCalendar(d CALENDAR_DATE)

Opens the calendar app on the device for a specific date.

Parameters:
d - The date to display in the calendar app.

requestReadPermission

FUNCTION requestReadPermission() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Explicitly show the permission dialog in case we have no permission On IOS this includes also the write permission

Returns:
TRUE upon success, FALSE otherwise

requestReadWritePermission

FUNCTION requestReadWritePermission() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Explicitly show the permission dialog in case we have no permission

Returns:
TRUE upon success, FALSE otherwise

requestWritePermission

FUNCTION requestWritePermission() RETURNS BOOLEAN

Explicitly show the permission dialog in case we have no permission

Returns:
TRUE upon success, FALSE otherwise
